result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel A Sorensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked, Court ordered counts 1 & 2 be concurrent to one another
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 04/14/2016 @ 8:30am
- Court ordered a progress report be prepared for the probation review date

miscConds.notes: $221.89 to be paid to Nicole D.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Restitution to be paid first before costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court did not order a DNA sample or a DNA surcharge because it is not mandatory in this matter.
COURT WILL DEFER RULING ON EXPUNCTION UNTIL THE REVIEW DATE

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Defendant is to be supervised by the Mental Health Unit.
- Continue counseling with Dr. Jensen at Shorehaven as deemed appropriate by provider.
- Continue treatment with Dr. Batory at American behavioral Clinics.
- No Contact with the victim or his family or residence.
- No Violent Contact with James H.
- Remain enrolled in school full time.
- Write a letter of apology to the victim's family and privde the letter to the agent. Counsel to provide a copy of the letter to the Court at the probation review date.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Court will waive costs and surcharges due to defendant's financial status
With credit for 90 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

05-02-2016/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner
As a correction to the 04-14-2016 sentence after revocation, per the CR-245, the court orders that the defendant pay the restitution, in the amount of $221.89, to Nicole D.   Restitution and surcharges to be paid by 10-14-16.
Failure to pay penalty is entry of a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel A Sorensen in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Defendant Samuel A Sorensen in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Court has reviewed report provided by defense counsel regarding competency in Racine County case.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentences defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 90 days.

AS TO COUNT 2: Court sentences defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 1, with credit for 75 days.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Court orders that this be a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court will waive costs and surcharges due to defendant's financial status.
Counsels have agreed to move date to 4-14-2016 at 8:15 for sentencing.  OTP to be completed.
Letter to court from Atty Luczak

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Atty Jason Luczak appears for the defendant who is in custody at Mendota Mental Health Institute for in-patient exam for Racine County Case 15CM2783.  Court adjourns matter to 4-20-2016 at 8:15 for status.
ADA Kristin Schrank is advised of date and given copy of report dated 2-23-2016 from Dr. Rawski.

Defendant Samuel A Sorensen in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Defendant Samuel A Sorensen in custody.  Kevin Shomin on behalf of Kristin Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing after revocation. Doctor's report in Racince County case 15CM2483 received and filed. Parties advise the court the competency evaluations completed in Racine indicate the defendant is not competent to proceed. Court ordered the proceedings in this case adjourned until a finding of competency is made in the Racine cases. Parties advised as of February 1, 2016, this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38, Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Samuel A Sorensen in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Defendant Samuel A Sorensen in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Defendant has a new pending case in Racine County and a competency evaluation has been ordered in that case. Parties request an adjournment in this case pending the results of the competency evaluation. Court granted the joint request for adjournment. Court vacated the probation review date of 4/14/16. State to do the OTP for the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Per request of the probatio agent, this matter needs to be set for sentencing after revocation. Attorney Luczak and ADA Schrank notified. Case adjourned to 12/21/15 at 1:30 p.m. for sentencing hearing in branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Rothstein
for review. os

Court retained this matter post-rotation. Case transferred back to Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

cf
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 AMENDED and COUNT 2-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.

Court advised the defendant of the discretionary sex offender registry requirements.
Parties request an adjourned sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Samuel A Sorensen in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State filed an amended information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Disorderly Conduct, contrary to sec. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b) Wis. Stats., a Class B Misdemeanor. 

COUNT 2- Disorderly Conduct, contrary to sec. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b) Wis. Stats., a Class B Misdemeanor. 

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the amended information and waived reading.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel A Sorensen in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Defense counsel requests an adjourned plea date for reasons stated on the record. State does not object. Court granted defense request for adjournment. State objects to conducting the sentencing hearing on the same date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel A Sorensen in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has obtained the private evaluation report. Parties anticipate a resolution in this matter and request a projected plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel A Sorensen in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for arraignment. Sidebar placed on the record. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense counsel will be obtaining a private evaluation of the defendant and requests an adjourned scheduling date. State does not object. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel A Sorensen in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Arraignment scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AJB; ND; and JH.

Defendant Samuel A Sorensen in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 02-12-2015 at 01:30pm
